channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache HTTP Server
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache HTTP Server

item.title: CVE-2022-22720|2024-08-03T03:21:48.980Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Apache HTTP Server 2.4.52 and earlier fails to close inbound connection when errors are encountered discarding the request body, exposing the server to HTTP Request Smuggling

item.title: CVE-2022-22721|2024-08-03T03:21:48.950Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: If LimitXMLRequestBody is set to allow request bodies larger than 350MB (defaults to 1M) on 32 bit systems an integer overflow happens which later causes out of bounds writes. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.52 and earlier.

item.title: CVE-2022-28330|2024-08-03T05:48:37.891Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Apache HTTP Server 2.4.53 and earlier on Windows may read beyond bounds when configured to process requests with the mod_isapi module.

item.title: CVE-2022-23943|2024-08-03T03:59:23.156Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Out-of-bounds Write vulnerability in mod_sed of Apache HTTP Server allows an attacker to overwrite heap memory with possibly attacker provided data. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4 version 2.4.52 and prior versions.

item.title: CVE-2022-31813|2024-08-03T07:26:01.124Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Apache HTTP Server 2.4.53 and earlier may not send the X-Forwarded-* headers to the origin server based on client side Connection header hop-by-hop mechanism. This may be used to bypass IP based authentication on the origin server/application.

item.title: CVE-2022-29404|2024-08-03T06:17:55.325Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: In Apache HTTP Server 2.4.53 and earlier, a malicious request to a lua script that calls r:parsebody(0) may cause a denial of service due to no default limit on possible input size.

item.title: CVE-2022-22719|2024-08-03T03:21:49.091Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: A carefully crafted request body can cause a read to a random memory area which could cause the process to crash. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.52 and earlier.

item.title: CVE-2022-30522|2024-08-03T06:48:36.355Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: If Apache HTTP Server 2.4.53 is configured to do transformations with mod_sed in contexts where the input to mod_sed may be very large, mod_sed may make excessively large memory allocations and trigger an abort.

item.title: CVE-2022-28614|2024-08-03T05:56:16.107Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: The ap_rwrite() function in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.53 and earlier may read unintended memory if an attacker can cause the server to reflect very large input using ap_rwrite() or ap_rputs(), such as with mod_luas r:puts() function. Modules compiled and distributed separately from Apache HTTP Server that use the 'ap_rputs' function and may pass it a very large (INT_MAX or larger) string must be compiled against current headers to resolve the issue.

item.title: CVE-2022-30556|2024-08-03T06:48:36.447Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Apache HTTP Server 2.4.53 and earlier may return lengths to applications calling r:wsread() that point past the end of the storage allocated for the buffer.

item.title: CVE-2022-26377|2024-08-03T05:03:32.881Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests ('HTTP Request Smuggling') vulnerability in mod_proxy_ajp of Apache HTTP Server allows an attacker to smuggle requests to the AJP server it forwards requests to. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server Apache HTTP Server 2.4 version 2.4.53 and prior versions.

item.title: CVE-2022-28615|2024-08-03T05:56:16.195Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Apache HTTP Server 2.4.53 and earlier may crash or disclose information due to a read beyond bounds in ap_strcmp_match() when provided with an extremely large input buffer. While no code distributed with the server can be coerced into such a call, third-party modules or lua scripts that use ap_strcmp_match() may hypothetically be affected.

item.title: CVE-2023-38709|2024-08-02T17:46:56.949Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
Faulty input validation in the core of Apache allows malicious or exploitable backend/content generators to split HTTP responses.
This issue affects Apache HTTP Server: through 2.4.58.

item.title: CVE-2024-36387|2024-08-02T03:37:05.009Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Serving WebSocket protocol upgrades over a HTTP/2 connection could result in a Null Pointer dereference, leading to a crash of the server process, degrading performance.

item.title: CVE-2024-38475|2024-07-31T20:24:11.619Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
Improper escaping of output in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows an attacker to map URLs to filesystem locations that are permitted to be served by the server but are not intentionally/directly reachable by any URL, resulting in code execution or source code disclosure.
Substitutions in server context that use a backreferences or variables as the first segment of the substitution are affected. Some unsafe RewiteRules will be broken by this change and the rewrite flag "UnsafePrefixStat" can be used to opt back in once ensuring the substitution is appropriately constrained.

item.title: CVE-2024-38475|2024-07-31T06:34:24.389Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
Improper escaping of output in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows an attacker to map URLs to filesystem locations that are permitted to be served by the server but are not intentionally/directly reachable by any URL, resulting in code execution or source code disclosure.
Substitutions in server context that use a backreferences or variables as the first segment of the substitution are affected. Some unsafe RewiteRules will be broken by this change and the rewrite flag "UnsafePrefixStat" can be used to opt back in once ensuring the substitution is appropriately constrained.

item.title: CVE-2024-38472|2024-07-26T03:55:30.695Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: SSRF in Apache HTTP Server on Windows allows to potentially leak NTML hashes to a malicious server via SSRF and malicious requests or content Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60 which fixes this issue. Note: Existing configurations that access UNC paths will have to configure new directive "UNCList" to allow access during request processing.

item.title: CVE-2024-39884|2024-07-23T18:53:16.539Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
A regression in the core of Apache HTTP Server 2.4.60 ignores some use of the legacy content-type based configuration of handlers. "AddType" and similar configuration, under some circumstances where files are requested indirectly, result in source code disclosure of local content. For example, PHP scripts may be served instead of interpreted.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.61, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-38477|2024-07-22T16:23:33.260Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: null pointer dereference in mod_proxy in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows an attacker to crash the server via a malicious request. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-36387|2024-07-22T16:22:16.714Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Serving WebSocket protocol upgrades over a HTTP/2 connection could result in a Null Pointer dereference, leading to a crash of the server process, degrading performance.

item.title: CVE-2024-27316|2024-07-22T08:42:14.089Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: HTTP/2 incoming headers exceeding the limit are temporarily buffered in nghttp2 in order to generate an informative HTTP 413 response. If a client does not stop sending headers, this leads to memory exhaustion.

item.title: CVE-2024-40898|2024-07-18T18:48:40.387Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
SSRF in Apache HTTP Server on Windows with mod_rewrite in server/vhost context, allows to potentially leak NTML hashes to a malicious server via SSRF and malicious requests.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.62 which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-38475|2024-07-10T03:55:18.150Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
Improper escaping of output in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows an attacker to map URLs to filesystem locations that are permitted to be served by the server but are not intentionally/directly reachable by any URL, resulting in code execution or source code disclosure.
Substitutions in server context that use a backreferences or variables as the first segment of the substitution are affected. Some unsafe RewiteRules will be broken by this change and the rewrite flag "UnsafePrefixStat" can be used to opt back in once ensuring the substitution is appropriately constrained.

item.title: CVE-2024-38472|2024-07-09T15:19:22.367Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: SSRF in Apache HTTP Server on Windows allows to potentially leak NTML hashes to a malicious server via SSRF and malicious requests or content Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60 which fixes this issue. Note: Existing configurations that access UNC paths will have to configure new directive "UNCList" to allow access during request processing.

item.title: CVE-2024-39884|2024-07-04T08:36:49.772Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
A regression in the core of Apache HTTP Server 2.4.60 ignores some use of the legacy content-type based configuration of handlers. "AddType" and similar configuration, under some circumstances where files are requested indirectly, result in source code disclosure of local content. For example, PHP scripts may be served instead of interpreted.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.61, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-36387|2024-07-02T10:05:15.503Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Serving WebSocket protocol upgrades over a HTTP/2 connection could result in a Null Pointer dereference, leading to a crash of the server process, degrading performance.

item.title: CVE-2024-38476|2024-07-01T18:15:40.071Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
Vulnerability in core of Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier are vulnerably to information disclosure, SSRF or local script execution via backend applications whose response headers are malicious or exploitable.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-38475|2024-07-01T18:15:12.292Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
Improper escaping of output in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows an attacker to map URLs to filesystem locations that are permitted to be served by the server but are not intentionally/directly reachable by any URL, resulting in code execution or source code disclosure.
Substitutions in server context that use a backreferences or variables as the first segment of the substitution are affected. Some unsafe RewiteRules will be broken by this change and the rewrite flag "UnsafePrefixStat" can be used to opt back in once ensuring the substitution is appropriately constrained.

item.title: CVE-2024-38477|2024-07-01T18:16:11.935Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: null pointer dereference in mod_proxy in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows an attacker to crash the server via a malicious request. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-39573|2024-07-01T18:16:44.297Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Potential SSRF in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows an attacker to cause unsafe RewriteRules to unexpectedly setup URL's to be handled by mod_proxy. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-38472|2024-07-01T18:12:27.616Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: SSRF in Apache HTTP Server on Windows allows to potentially leak NTML hashes to a malicious server via SSRF and malicious requests or content Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60 which fixes this issue. Note: Existing configurations that access UNC paths will have to configure new directive "UNCList" to allow access during request processing.

item.title: CVE-2024-36387|2024-07-01T18:10:25.512Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Serving WebSocket protocol upgrades over a HTTP/2 connection could result in a Null Pointer dereference, leading to a crash of the server process, degrading performance.

item.title: CVE-2024-38474|2024-07-01T18:14:47.004Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
Substitution encoding issue in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows attacker to execute scripts in directories permitted by the configuration but not directly reachable by any URL or source disclosure of scripts meant to only to be executed as CGI.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue.
Some RewriteRules that capture and substitute unsafely will now fail unless rewrite flag "UnsafeAllow3F" is specified.

item.title: CVE-2024-38473|2024-07-01T18:14:21.520Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Encoding problem in mod_proxy in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows request URLs with incorrect encoding to be sent to backend services, potentially bypassing authentication via crafted requests. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-24795|2024-04-04T19:20:48.803Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
HTTP Response splitting in multiple modules in Apache HTTP Server allows an attacker that can inject malicious response headers into backend applications to cause an HTTP desynchronization attack.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.59, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-27316|2024-04-04T19:21:41.984Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: HTTP/2 incoming headers exceeding the limit are temporarily buffered in nghttp2 in order to generate an informative HTTP 413 response. If a client does not stop sending headers, this leads to memory exhaustion.

item.title: CVE-2023-38709|2024-04-04T19:19:35.467Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
Faulty input validation in the core of Apache allows malicious or exploitable backend/content generators to split HTTP responses.
This issue affects Apache HTTP Server: through 2.4.58.

item.title: CVE-2024-39573|2024-07-01T20:44:44.754Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Potential SSRF in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows an attacker to cause unsafe RewriteRules to unexpectedly setup URL's to be handled by mod_proxy. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-38476|2024-07-02T18:27:03.011Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
Vulnerability in core of Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier are vulnerably to information disclosure, SSRF or local script execution via backend applications whose response headers are malicious or exploitable.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-38475|2024-07-05T18:03:48.637Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
Improper escaping of output in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows an attacker to map URLs to filesystem locations that are permitted to be served by the server but are not intentionally/directly reachable by any URL, resulting in code execution or source code disclosure.
Substitutions in server context that use a backreferences or variables as the first segment of the substitution are affected. Some unsafe RewiteRules will be broken by this change and the rewrite flag "UnsafePrefixStat" can be used to opt back in once ensuring the substitution is appropriately constrained.

item.title: CVE-2024-38474|2024-07-09T18:02:49.344Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
Substitution encoding issue in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows attacker to execute scripts in directories permitted by the configuration but not directly reachable by any URL or source disclosure of scripts meant to only to be executed as CGI.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue.
Some RewriteRules that capture and substitute unsafely will now fail unless rewrite flag "UnsafeAllow3F" is specified.

item.title: CVE-2024-40898|2024-07-18T09:32:06.990Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
SSRF in Apache HTTP Server on Windows with mod_rewrite in server/vhost context, allows to potentially leak NTML hashes to a malicious server via SSRF and malicious requests.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.62 which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-40725|2024-07-18T09:32:43.929Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
A partial fix for CVE-2024-39884 in the core of Apache HTTP Server 2.4.61 ignores some use of the legacy content-type based configuration of handlers. "AddType" and similar configuration, under some circumstances where files are requested indirectly, result in source code disclosure of local content. For example, PHP scripts may be served instead of interpreted.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.62, which fixes this issue.
